help.association.description:validation: 在本节中，为问题配置正确答案。
默认情况下，负分将归一化为零。另一方面，允许负分意味着在应用处罚时，分数可能降至零以下。
如果问题有多个正确的整体解决方案，请添加备用响应。
定义是自动标记问题，还是必须手动标记问题。
可为响应授予的最高分。需要由开发团队配置。
如果学生尝试提问，则表示最小分数的正值。
指示将因错误响应而扣除多少标记的值。

定义是否应应用分数舍入。选项包括：
  • 无：总体问题分数将分为正确答案，四舍五入到小数点位四位，例如 2.6666
  • 楼层：总体问题分数将按正确答案进行划分，并四舍五入到最接近的整数。
仅适用于部分匹配评分。

问题标记的分发方式。
  • 完全匹配 - 问题的所有部分都必须正确回答才能获得标记。
  • 每个响应的" 部分匹配"- 每个正确的响应元素都将被授予个人分数。
  • 部分匹配 - 每个正确的响应元素将单独评分，并且总问题分数将在响应之间分配。
启用此选项后，将从问题中删除所有评分。这对于创建练习问题很有用。
为正确响应而获奖的分数。

help.audio.description:silence_stop_dura: 在停止录制之前允许的音频静音持续时间（以秒为单位）。默认情况下，此值设置为 0，这意味着静音检测处于关闭状态。

响应容器的 ARIA 标签。如果未提供标签，则默认情况下标签将为"响应区域"。
分别为每个响应容器配置属性，如"高度"和"宽度"。
响应容器的高度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"100em"。

定义是自动标记问题，还是必须手动标记问题。

如果学生尝试提问，则表示最小分数的正值。
指示将因错误响应而扣除多少标记的值。

定义是否应应用分数舍入。选项包括：
  • 无：总体问题分数将分为正确答案，四舍五入到小数点位四位，例如 2.6666
  • 楼层：总体问题分数将按正确答案进行划分，并四舍五入到最接近的整数。
仅适用于部分匹配评分。

问题标记的分发方式。
  • 完全匹配 - 问题的所有部分都必须正确回答才能获得标记。
  • 每个响应的" 部分匹配"- 每个正确的响应元素都将被授予个人分数。
  • 部分匹配 - 每个正确的响应元素将单独评分，并且总问题分数将在响应之间分配。
启用此选项后，将从问题中删除所有评分。这对于创建练习问题很有用。

响应容器的 ARIA 标签。如果未提供标签，则默认情况下标签将为"响应区域"。
响应容器的高度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"100em"。
公式字段中的初始值。如果使用响应容器，则只有它们是可编辑的。

help.clozechemistry.description:symbols: 从要显示在键盘上的符号组范围中选择。还可以为键盘创建自定义符号。
标签以 LaTeX 格式显示在键盘顶部。对简单的文本数据使用 [文本] 包装。
标题将显示为 alt 文本或将鼠标悬停在上方。
输入要在键盘上显示的符号。
help.clozechemistry.description:template: 这是一个可以添加文本、表格、图像和响应框的区域。单击"富文本编辑器中的插入响应"按钮以添加响应框，或将键盘上的下划线按钮按两次作为快捷方式。
help.clozechemistry.description:text_blo: 定义不会呈现为 LaTeX 的自定义文本列表。可用于测量单位，例如厘米、米、毫米。
help.clozechemistry.description:ui_style: 控制此问题字体的大小。选项有："小"（11px）、"正常"（14px）、"大"（17px）、"超大"（20px）和"大"（24px）。
启用后，这将将浮动键盘位于响应区域的最后一行下方。否则，这将部分重叠响应区域。
控制响应输入区域的最小宽度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"30em"。
缩放模板标记区域中的内容。选项有：提升 - 150% 或正常 - 100%。

键盘类型可用。选项包括：
  • 浮动 - 可拖动键盘，当学生点击响应框时出现
  • 块 - 不可拖动键盘，始终可见
  • 对焦块 - 不可拖动键盘;当学生单击响应框时出现
  • 无 - 未显示键盘
显示在验证标签左侧的数字字符。仅在审核状态中可见。
help.clozechemistry.description:validati: 在本节中，为问题配置正确答案。
默认情况下，负分将归一化为零。另一方面，允许负分意味着在应用处罚时，分数可能降至零以下。
如果问题有多个正确的整体解决方案，请添加备用响应。
添加多个对象以验证响应。列表中的每个项目都必须与问题响应匹配才能被视为有效。
正确响应的纯文本版本，在审阅状态中可供屏幕阅读器用户使用。
在下拉菜单中选择问题评分方法之一。仅适用于着色、数学和化学问题类型。
所选方法的额外选项。
指定重要小数位数。最大值为 20。
将学生回复中的"&a"和"a"视为相同。
忽略术语和因子的顺序。例如，x=1 和 1+x 都被认为是正确的。
反转验证中指定的响应。任何响应都是正确的，但作者设置的回复除外。
在学生的回复中，将"ab"和"a amp;nbsp;b"视为相同。
输入问题的正确答案。
定义是自动标记问题，还是必须手动标记问题。
可为响应授予的最高分。需要由开发团队配置。
如果学生尝试提问，则表示最小分数的正值。
指示将因错误响应而扣除多少标记的值。

定义是否应应用分数舍入。选项包括：
  • 无：总体问题分数将分为正确答案，四舍五入到小数点位四位，例如 2.6666
  • 楼层：总体问题分数将按正确答案进行划分，并四舍五入到最接近的整数。
仅适用于部分匹配评分。

问题标记的分发方式。
  • 完全匹配 - 问题的所有部分都必须正确回答才能获得标记。
  • 每个响应的" 部分匹配"- 每个正确的响应元素都将被授予个人分数。
  • 部分匹配 - 每个正确的响应元素将单独评分，总问题分数将在回答之间分配。
启用此选项后，将从问题中删除所有评分。这对于创建练习问题很有用。
问题的正确回答。
为正确响应而获奖的分数。
在本节中，为图像上的响应框配置验证 - 每个协议框表示响应框之一。
正确响应的纯文本版本，在审阅状态中可供屏幕阅读器用户使用。

默认情况下，负分将归一化为零。另一方面，允许负分意味着在应用处罚时，分数可能降至零以下。

在下拉菜单中选择问题评分方法之一。仅适用于着色、数学和化学问题类型。
所选方法的额外选项。
将小写"e"视为欧拉的号码。作者选择此选项以将默认解释覆盖为科学表示法，并验证使用小写"e"表示与 Euler 编号等效的响应。
当学生需要插入间隔表示法（不匹配的括号类型，例如 +1，3）时，必须启用此选项。
允许在数字大于 1000 的数字中使用不同的千位和十进制分隔符。

用于指定语法模式的语法规则的参数。必须输入为 ormat[.]。例如"
umber {3}"表示任何小数位为 3 位，"=小数{4}"表示任何具有 4 位小数的小数。
使用括号分组与等值方法时，请启用此标志。此标志强制等光远离其默认状态，以识别括号并正确支持乘法的交换属性。
在尚未指定方程的两面时比较两个常量方程时使用，例如 {{response}} + {{response}} = {{response}}.
指定重要小数位数。最大值为 20。

根据表达式类型选择允许的因素。选项包括：
  • 整数
  • 实数
  • 复杂数字
忽略整数之前系数 1。例如，1x+2 和 x+2 将被视为平等。
将学生回复中的"&a"和"a"视为相同。

定义是否应应用分数舍入。选项包括：
  • 无：总体问题分数将分为正确答案，四舍五入到小数点位四位，例如 2.6666
  • 楼层：总体问题分数将按正确答案进行划分，并四舍五入到最接近的整数。
仅适用于部分匹配评分。

问题标记的分发方式。
  • 完全匹配 - 问题的所有部分都必须正确回答才能获得标记。
  • 每个响应的" 部分匹配"- 每个正确的响应元素都将被授予个人分数。
  • 部分匹配 - 每个正确的响应元素将单独评分，总问题分数将在回答之间分配。
启用此选项后，将从问题中删除所有评分。这对于创建练习问题很有用。

为正确响应而获奖的分数。
在本节中，为图像上的响应框配置验证 - 每个协议框表示响应框之一。
正确响应的纯文本版本，在审阅状态中可供屏幕阅读器用户使用。

所选方法的额外选项。
将小写"e"视为欧拉的号码。作者选择此选项以将默认解释覆盖为科学表示法，并验证使用小写"e"表示与 Euler 编号等效的响应。

在尚未指定方程的两面时比较两个常量方程时使用，例如 {{response}} + {{response}} = {{response}}.

help.clozetext.description:: 使用文本输入将问题类型进行。

响应区域中将显示具有非典型字母和特殊符号的字符映射。有 3 个字符映射可用：
  • 标准阿尔法

help.clozetext.description:instant_feedb: 启用问题下方的"检查答案"按钮，该按钮将为用户提供有关其回答的即时反馈。
help.clozetext.description:instructor_st: 在评估期间向监考员/讲师提供其他详细信息;从来没有显示给学生。可以在问题编辑器中预览。
help.clozetext.description:is_math: 启用此选项允许在问题中呈现 LaTeX 或 MathML。如果在禁用此选项时尝试输入数学，则 LaTeX/MathML 不会在屏幕上正确呈现。
help.clozetext.description:math_renderer: 当问题包含数学时，此设置允许您选择首选数学渲染器：MathJax 或 MathQuill。
help.clozetext.description:max_length: 定义可输入到响应框中的最大字符数。最大值为 250 个字符。

响应容器的高度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"100em"。

可添加到响应输入区域的占位符文本，当用户开始键入时，该文本将消失。

分别为每个响应容器配置属性，如"高度"和"宽度"。

定义单词限制是否应显示在工具栏中。选项包括：
  • 始终打开 - 字数限制始终显示。
  • 在限制 - 字限制将仅在达到限制时显示。
  • 关闭 - 单词限制不会显示。
help.formulaessayV2.description:showHint: 将鼠标悬停在符号组键上时，禁用键盘左上角显示的提示，包括键盘快捷键和组标题。
help.formulaessayV2.description:spellche: 在用户响应区域启用或禁用浏览器拼写检查、自动大写、自动完成和自动更正属性。
help.formulaessayV2.description:stimulus: 问题刺激。这可能包括通过数学编辑器输入的文本、表格、图像、资源和 LaTeX。
在审核模式下显示备用（例如缩写）问题刺激。
help.formulaessayV2.description:submit_o: 确定用户在超过单词限制时可以保存/提交文本。
help.formulaessayV2.description:symbols: 从要显示在键盘上的符号组范围中选择。还可以为键盘创建自定义符号。

标题将显示为 alt 文本或将鼠标悬停在上方。

help.formulaessayV2.description:text_blo: 定义不会呈现为 LaTeX 的自定义文本列表。可用于测量单位，例如厘米、米、毫米。
help.formulaessayV2.description:ui_style: 控制此问题字体的大小。选项有："小"（11px）、"正常"（14px）、"大"（17px）、"超大"（20px）和"大"（24px）。
文本输入区域的最大高度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"10em"。
文本输入区域的最小高度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"8em"。
help.formulaessayV2.description:validati: 在本节中，为问题配置正确答案。
可为响应授予的最高分。需要由开发团队配置。
如果学生尝试提问，则表示最小分数的正值。
启用此选项后，将从问题中删除所有评分。这对于创建练习问题很有用。

help.formulainput.description:ui_style.t:
在可用的不同键盘样式之间进行选择：

  • 浮动键盘： 键盘将一直显示。
  • 块键盘： 键盘仅在用户单击响应框时显示，所有内容都将在响应框下方移动。
  • 块对焦键盘： 只有在用户单击响应框时，才能显示键盘。
  • 仅固定手写： 当用户单击响应框时，将显示一个固定位置的全屏宽度手写输入区域。
  • 本机/无符号： 不显示键盘。

help.formulaV2.description:response_cont: 用于配置响应框。使用响应容器（全局）一次更改所有响应框。
响应容器的 ARIA 标签。如果未提供标签，则默认情况下标签将为"响应区域"。
分别为每个响应容器配置属性，如"高度"和"宽度"。
响应容器的高度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"100em"。

help.formulaV2.description:ui_style.font: 控制此问题字体的大小。选项有："小"（11px）、"正常"（14px）、"大"（17px）、"超大"（20px）和"大"（24px）。
help.formulaV2.description:ui_style.keyb: 启用后，这将在打开时将浮动键盘位于问题下方（位于响应区域的最后一行下方）。否则，这将显示在响应区域的每一行下方。
help.formulaV2.description:ui_style.min_: 控制响应输入区域的最小宽度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"30em"。
help.formulaV2.description:ui_style.resp: 缩放 LaTeX/模板标记区域中的内容。选项有：提升 - 150% 或正常 - 100%。
help.formulaV2.description:ui_style.tran: 确定响应区域是否为透明。
help.formulaV2.description:ui_style.type:
键盘类型可用。选项包括：
  • 浮动 - 可拖动键盘，当学生点击进入响应框时出现
  • 块 - 不可拖动键盘，始终可见
  • 对焦块 - 不可拖动键盘;当学生单击响应框时出现
  • 无 - 未显示键盘
help.formulaV2.description:validation: 在本节中，为问题配置正确答案。
help.formulaV2.description:validation.al: 默认情况下，负分将归一化为零。另一方面，允许负分意味着在应用处罚时，分数可能降至零以下。
如果问题有多个正确的整体解决方案，请添加备用响应。
添加多个对象以验证响应。列表中的每个项目都必须与问题响应匹配才能被视为有效。
正确响应的纯文本版本，在审阅状态中可供屏幕阅读器用户使用。
在下拉菜单中选择问题评分方法之一。仅适用于着色、数学和化学问题类型。
所选方法的额外选项。
将小写"e"视为欧拉的号码。作者选择此选项以将默认解释覆盖为科学表示法，并验证使用小写"e"表示与 Euler 编号等效的响应。
当学生需要插入间隔表示法（不匹配的括号类型，例如 +1，3）时，必须启用此选项。
允许在数字大于 1000 的数字中使用不同的千位和十进制分隔符。

用于指定语法模式的语法规则的参数。必须输入为 ormat[.]。例如"
umber {3}"表示任何小数位为 3 位，"=小数{4}"表示任何具有 4 位小数的小数。
使用括号分组与等值方法时，请启用此标志。此标志强制等光远离其默认状态，以识别括号并正确支持乘法的交换属性。
在尚未指定方程的两面时比较两个常量方程时使用，例如 {{response}} + {{response}} = {{response}}.
指定重要小数位数。最大值为 20。

根据表达式类型选择允许的因素。选项包括：
  • 整数
  • 实数
  • 复杂数字
忽略整数之前系数 1。例如，1x+2 和 x+2 将被视为平等。
将学生回复中的"&a"和"a"视为相同。
忽略术语和因子的顺序。例如，x=1 和 1+x 都被认为是正确的。
忽略在响应区域中输入的任何 LaTeX 文本。作者不需要在验证区域的模板标记区域中输入的所有文本。
忽略十进制分隔符后尾随零，例如 1000 和 1000.000 将被视为相等。
反转验证中指定的响应。任何响应都是正确的，但作者设置的回复除外。
选择十进制分隔符。选项有：点或逗号。
选择一千个分隔符。选项有：点、逗号或空格。
启用此标志会将所有字母视为变量，并且它们不会被识别为度量单位。
在学生的回复中，将"ab"和"a amp;nbsp;b"视为相同。
输入问题的正确答案。
help.formulaV2.description:validation.au: 定义是自动标记问题，还是必须手动标记问题。
help.formulaV2.description:validation.ma: 可为响应授予的最高分。需要由开发团队配置。
help.formulaV2.description:validation.mi: 如果学生尝试提问，则表示最小分数的正值。
help.formulaV2.description:validation.pe: 指示将因错误响应而扣除多少标记的值。
help.formulaV2.description:validation.ro:
定义是否应应用分数舍入。选项包括：
  • 无：总体问题分数将分为正确答案，四舍五入到小数点位四位，例如 2.6666
  • 楼层：总体问题分数将按正确答案进行划分，并四舍五入到最接近的整数。
仅适用于部分匹配评分。
help.formulaV2.description:validation.sc:
问题标记的分发方式。
  • 完全匹配 - 问题的所有部分都必须正确回答才能获得标记。
help.formulaV2.description:validation.un: 启用此选项后，将从问题中删除所有评分。这对于创建练习问题很有用。
help.formulaV2.description:validation.va: 问题的正确回答。
为正确响应而获奖的分数。
添加多个对象以验证响应。列表中的每个项目都必须与问题响应匹配才能被视为有效。
正确响应的纯文本版本，在审阅状态中可供屏幕阅读器用户使用。

图像可用作网格背景。上传图像或将图像 URL 粘贴到此字段中。文件可以以 JPEG、PNG、GIF 和 SVG 格式上传，并且必须小于 500KB。

图形的高度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"100em"。

用于为标签提供空间的图形周围的边距。可以是单个值，例如"20px"，也可以是 CSS 格式化的字符串，例如"20px 10px 20px"（对于每侧具有不同值的边距）。字符串可以包含：
  • 两个值："上下"和"从左到右"
  • 三个值："左上下角"
  • 四个值："左下下角"
显示在验证标签左侧的数字字符。仅在审核状态中可见。
图形的高度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"100em"。
help.graphplotting.description:validatio: 在本节中，为问题配置正确答案。
默认情况下，负分将归一化为零。另一方面，允许负分意味着在应用处罚时，分数可能降至零以下。
如果问题有多个正确的整体解决方案，请添加备用响应。
定义是自动标记问题，还是必须手动标记问题。
忽略在同一图形中多次绘制的形状。如果学生意外绘制重复的形状或点，则防止验证失败。当设置为"是"时，如果重复点绘制在它们所属的线的同一斜率上，则它们将被忽略。当设置为"严格比较"时，将只忽略具有完全相同坐标的重复点。当设置为"否"时，不会忽略重复形状。
可为响应授予的最高分。需要由开发团队配置。
如果学生尝试提问，则表示最小分数的正值。
指示将因错误响应而扣除多少标记的值。

定义是否应应用分数舍入。选项包括：
  • 无：总体问题分数将分为正确答案，四舍五入到小数点位四位，例如 2.6666
  • 楼层：总体问题分数将按正确答案进行划分，并四舍五入到最接近的整数。
仅适用于部分匹配评分。

问题标记的分发方式。
  • 完全匹配 - 问题的所有部分都必须正确回答才能获得标记。
启用此选项后，将从问题中删除所有评分。这对于创建练习问题很有用。
为正确响应而获奖的分数。

help.imageclozeformula.description:text_: 定义不会呈现为 LaTeX 的自定义文本列表。可用于测量单位，例如厘米、米、毫米。
help.imageclozeformula.description:ui_st: 控制此问题字体的大小。选项有："小"（11px）、"正常"（14px）、"大"（17px）、"超大"（20px）和"大"（24px）。
启用后，这将将浮动键盘位于响应区域的最后一行下方。否则，这将部分重叠响应区域。
控制响应输入区域的最小宽度。默认单位为"px"，如果未提供单位，将追加。对于"px"以外的单位，请向字段中提供它们。例如"30em"。
缩放 LaTeX/模板标记区域中的内容。选项有：提升 - 150% 或正常 - 100%。

键盘类型可用。选项包括：
  • 浮动 - 可拖动键盘，当学生点击进入响应框时出现
  • 块 - 不可拖动键盘，始终可见
  • 对焦块 - 不可拖动键盘;当学生单击响应框时出现
  • 无 - 未显示键盘
显示在验证标签左侧的数字字符。仅在审核状态中可见。
help.imageclozeformula.description:valid: 在本节中，为问题配置正确答案。
默认情况下，负分将归一化为零。另一方面，允许负分意味着在应用处罚时，分数可能降至零以下。
如果问题有多个正确的整体解决方案，请添加备用响应。
添加多个对象以验证响应。列表中的每个项目都必须与问题响应匹配才能被视为有效。
正确响应的纯文本版本，在审阅状态中可供屏幕阅读器用户使用。
在下拉菜单中选择问题评分方法之一。仅适用于着色、数学和化学问题类型。
所选方法的额外选项。
将小写"e"视为欧拉的号码。作者选择此选项以将默认解释覆盖为科学表示法，并验证使用小写"e"表示与 Euler 编号等效的响应。
当学生需要插入间隔表示法（不匹配的括号类型，例如 +1，3）时，必须启用此选项。
允许在数字大于 1000 的数字中使用不同的千位和十进制分隔符。

用于指定语法模式的语法规则的参数。必须输入为 ormat[.]。例如"
umber {3}"表示任何小数位为 3 位，"=小数{4}"表示任何具有 4 位小数的小数。
使用括号分组与等值方法时，请启用此标志。此标志强制等光远离其默认状态，以识别括号并正确支持乘法的交换属性。
在尚未指定方程的两面时比较两个常量方程时使用，例如 {{response}} + {{response}} = {{response}}.
指定重要小数位数。最大值为 20。

根据表达式类型选择允许的因素。选项包括：
  • 整数
  • 实数
  • 复杂数字
忽略整数之前系数 1。例如，1x+2 和 x+2 将被视为平等。
将学生回复中的"&a"和"a"视为相同。
忽略术语和因子的顺序。例如，x=1 和 1+x 都被认为是正确的。
忽略在响应区域中输入的任何 LaTeX 文本。作者不需要在验证区域的模板标记区域中输入的所有文本。
忽略十进制分隔符后尾随零，例如 1000 和 1000.000 将被视为相等。
反转验证中指定的响应。任何响应都是正确的，但作者设置的回复除外。
选择十进制分隔符。选项有：点或逗号。
选择一千个分隔符。选项有：点、逗号或空格。
启用此标志会将所有字母视为变量，并且它们不会被识别为度量单位。
在学生的回复中，将"ab"和"a amp;nbsp;b"视为相同。
输入问题的正确答案。
定义是自动标记问题，还是必须手动标记问题。
可为响应授予的最高分。需要由开发团队配置。
如果学生尝试提问，则表示最小分数的正值。
指示将因错误响应而扣除多少标记的值。

定义是否应应用分数舍入。选项包括：
  • 无：总体问题分数将分为正确答案，四舍五入到小数点位四位，例如 2.6666
  • 楼层：总体问题分数将按正确答案进行划分，并四舍五入到最接近的整数。
仅适用于部分匹配评分。

问题标记的分发方式。
  • 完全匹配 - 问题的所有部分都必须正确回答才能获得标记。
  • 每个响应的" 部分匹配"- 每个正确的响应元素都将被授予个人分数。
  • 部分匹配 - 每个正确的响应元素将单独评分，总问题分数将在回答之间分配。
启用此选项后，将从问题中删除所有评分。这对于创建练习问题很有用。
问题的正确回答。
为正确响应而获奖的分数。
在本节中，为图像上的响应框配置验证 - 每个协议框表示响应框之一。
正确响应的纯文本版本，在审阅状态中可供屏幕阅读器用户使用。

help.imageclozeformula.name:image.title: 悬停时的文本
help.imageclozetext.description:: Cloze question type with text inputs placed within an image.
help.imageclozetext.description:aria_lab: Text entered here will help assistive technology (e.g. a screen reader) attach a label to the image for accessibility purposes.
help.imageclozetext.description:case_sen: Determines whether the student response must match the letter case set by the author in the correct response. E.g. when enabled, only one of Yes, yes, or YES will be accepted
help.imageclozetext.description:characte:
A character map with non-typical letters and special symbols will appear in the response area. There are 3 character maps available:
  • Standard alpha
  • Numerical (appears by default when Has Mathematical Formulas? is enabled)
  • Custom (insert special characters in the Characters to Display field)
help.imageclozetext.description:feedback: If Check Answer is enabled, this field determines how many times a user can click on the Check Answer button. 0 means unlimited.
help.imageclozetext.description:ignore_l: Determines whether the automatic marking will ignore leading and trailing spaces. E.g. 'a' and ' a ' will be treated as the same.
help.imageclozetext.description:image.al: Text that will appear if the image cannot be displayed to the user.
help.imageclozetext.description:image.pr: When the screen size has changed, the image size will not be scaled accordingly.
help.imageclozetext.description:image.sc: When the font size has been increased or decreased, the image size will be scaled accordingly.
help.imageclozetext.description:image.sr: Upload an image or paste an image URL in this field. Files can be uploaded in JPEG, PNG, GIF and SVG format, and must be less than 500KB.
help.imageclozetext.description:image.ti: Text shown when the cursor hovers over the image.
help.imageclozetext.description:instant_: Enables the Check Answer button underneath the question, which will provide the student with instant feedback on their response(s).
help.imageclozetext.description:instruct: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.
help.imageclozetext.description:is_math: Enabling this option allows LaTeX or MathML to be rendered in the question. If you try to enter math while this option is disabled, the LaTeX/MathML will not render properly on screen.
help.imageclozetext.description:math_ren: When a question contains math, this setting allows you to select your preferred math renderer: MathJax or MathQuill.
help.imageclozetext.description:max_leng: Defines maximum number of characters that can be entered in response boxes. Maximum value is 250 characters.
help.imageclozetext.description:metadata: A multi-use field that is used to add acknowledgements (copyright, credits, thanks).
Used to display response feedback/rationale to the student.
Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the student.
Refers to a pre-created rubric in the Learnosity item bank.
A sample answer that is stored for display/reference when teacher scoring.
help.imageclozetext.description:multiple: Students can enter multiple lines of text/characters in the response area.
help.imageclozetext.description:response: Used to configure the response boxes. Use Response Container (global) to make changes to all response boxes at once.
The height of the response container. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "100em".
This is a setting for tablet users, and defines which keyboard (text or number) will be displayed by default.
Placeholder text that can be added into the response entry area, which disappears when user starts typing.
A red pointer will display on either the top, bottom, right, or left of the response box.

This setting ensures that the position of the response boxes stays at the position set by the author, regardless of changes to the font size or container's size, i.e. it ensures that the position of the responses stays at top: 0, left: 0 of the container.
The width of the response container. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "100em".
Configure attributes, such as Height and Width, for each response container individually.
This is a setting for tablet users, and defines which keyboard (text or number) will be displayed by default.
Text to display as a hint to the user of what to enter
A red pointer will display on either the top, bottom, right, or left of the response box.
Where the response boxes are located on the image. Click on +ADD to add more response boxes, and drag and drop each response to arrange it on the image.
help.imageclozetext.description:spellche: Enable or disable browser spellcheck, autocapitalize, autocomplete and autocorrect attributes on the user response area.
help.imageclozetext.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
Shows an alternate (e.g. abbreviated) question stimulus when in review mode.
help.imageclozetext.description:ui_style: Controls the size of the font for this question. Options are: "small"(11px), "normal"(14px), "large"(17px), "extra large"(20px) and "huge"(24px).
Numeration characters displayed to the left of the validation label. Only visible in review state.
help.imageclozetext.description:validati: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.

If true, the responses will be matched against all combinations of valid and alternate responses for the response position. Otherwise, responses will be scored from the valid responses, or one of the alternate responses, but never a combination of them.
The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
A value which indicates how many marks will be deducted for an incorrect response.

Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.

The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
The correct response for the question.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).
help.imageclozetext.name:image.title: Text on hover
help.imagetool.description:: Embed an image tool as an additional feature to the current content. You can use your own image or the supplied ruler or protractor.
help.imagetool.description:alt: A description of the image to be displayed when the image can't load, and to be read aloud for users of screen readers.
help.imagetool.description:button: Renders a button for toggling the image tool.
help.imagetool.description:buttonicon: Supports a protractor, ruler, generic or a URI to an image.
help.imagetool.description:height: Height of the image in pixels. Can only be used with custom URI image.
help.imagetool.description:image:
Supports a protractor, ruler (options below) or a URI to an image.
Ruler options:
  • ruler-15cm-72dpi
  • ruler-30cm-72dpi
  • ruler-6in-72dpi
  • ruler-12in-72dpi
  • ruler-6in-15cm-72dpi
  • ruler-12in-30cm-72dpi

DPI refers to dots per inch and is a setting you can choose when exporting images from many graphics design software applications. Make sure to test the ruler against the image you upload to make sure the ruler matches your image.
help.imagetool.description:label: Toggle button label text to display.
help.imagetool.description:rotate: Renders a rotate icon that is draggable and allows the image rotate.
help.imagetool.description:visible: Overrides the default visibility of the Image Tool when specified.
help.imagetool.description:width: Width of the image in pixels. Can only be used with custom URI image.
help.imagetool.name:label: Label
help.imageupload.description:: Users can upload and annotate an image, or annotate a provided image.
help.imageupload.description:case_sensit: If true, responses will be compared against valid_responses considering the letters' case.
help.imageupload.description:feedback_at: If Check Answer is enabled, this field determines how many times a user can click on the Check Answer button. 0 means unlimited.

help.imageupload.description:max_width: Max width of response area. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "10em", or set to 'none' to stretch to full width of container.

Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.
The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
A value which indicates how many marks will be deducted for an incorrect response.

Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.

The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.

List of valid responses corresponding to validation areas on the stimulus image.
help.linereader.description:: Display an assistive tool that allows the user to view one line of text at a time.

help.longtextV2.description:instructor_s: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.

help.longtextV2.description:placeholder: Placeholder text that can be added into the response entry area, which disappears when user starts typing.

Defines whether the word limit should be displayed in the toolbar or not. The options are:
  • Always On - Word Limit is always displayed.
  • On Limit - Word Limit will only be displayed when the limit is reached.
  • Off - Word Limit will not be displayed.
help.longtextV2.description:showHints: Disables hints, including keyboard shortcuts and group titles, shown on the keypad's top left corner when hovering over a symbol group key.

help.longtextV2.description:submit_over_: Determines if the user can save/submit text when the word limit has been exceeded.
help.longtextV2.description:symbols: Choose from a range of symbol groups to be displayed on the keypad. Custom symbols can also be created for the keypad.
help.longtextV2.description:symbols.labe: Label to be shown on the top of the keyboard in the LaTeX format. Use \text{} wrapper for simple text data.
help.longtextV2.description:symbols.titl: Title will appear as alt text or on hover over.
help.longtextV2.description:symbols.valu: Enter symbols to appear on keyboard.
help.longtextV2.description:text_blocks[: Defines a list of custom text that will not be rendered as LaTeX. Useful for units of measurement, e.g. cm, m, mm.
help.longtextV2.description:ui_style.fon: Controls the size of the font for this question. Options are: "small"(11px), "normal"(14px), "large"(17px), "extra large"(20px) and "huge"(24px).

help.longtextV2.description:ui_style.min: The minimum height of the text entry area. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "8em".
help.longtextV2.description:validation: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
help.longtextV2.description:validation.m: The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.

help.mcq.description:feedback_attempts: If Check Answer is enabled, this field determines how many times a user can click on the Check Answer button. 0 means unlimited.
help.mcq.description:instant_feedback: Enables the Check Answer button underneath the question, which will provide the student with instant feedback on their response(s).
help.mcq.description:instructor_stimulus: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.
help.mcq.description:is_math: Enabling this option allows LaTeX or MathML to be rendered in the question. If you try to enter math while this option is disabled, the LaTeX/MathML will not render properly on screen.
help.mcq.description:math_renderer: When a question contains math, this setting allows you to select your preferred math renderer: MathJax or MathQuill.
help.mcq.description:max_selection: Defines how many options can be selected at most when giving an answer. 0 means an unlimited amount.
help.mcq.description:metadata.acknowledg: A multi-use field that is used to add acknowledgements (copyright, credits, thanks).
help.mcq.description:metadata.distractor: Used to display response feedback/rationale to the student.
Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the student.
help.mcq.description:metadata.response_s: A seed to use to randomise the order of response options. If set, the responses will be shuffled according to this seed, and all students will see the same randomised order.
help.mcq.description:metadata.rubric_ref: Refers to a pre-created rubric in the Learnosity item bank.
help.mcq.description:metadata.sample_ans: A sample answer that is stored for display/reference when teacher scoring.
help.mcq.description:min_selection: Defines how many options should be selected at least when giving an answer. 0 means an unlimited amount.
help.mcq.description:multiple_responses: The student will be able to select more than one answer, when this option is enabled. Also when this option is enabled, author can set min_selection and max_selection to control the allowed minimum and maximum responses.
help.mcq.description:options[*]: A list of possible responses for the student to select the correct answer(s) from.
help.mcq.description:options[*].label: Label to be displayed for this option - plain string with HTML allowed for formatting or mathjax syntax.
help.mcq.description:options[*].value: Value for this option that would be stored as the response if selected.
help.mcq.description:shuffle_options: When this is enabled, the response options will display in a different order each time the question is rendered.
help.mcq.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
help.mcq.description:stimulus_review: Shows an alternate (e.g. abbreviated) question stimulus when in review mode.
help.mcq.description:ui_style.choice_lab: Numeration characters to be displayed to the left of the responses. This option is only available in Block layout.
help.mcq.description:ui_style.columns: The amount of columns that the possible responses will be divided across.
help.mcq.description:ui_style.fontsize: Controls the size of the font for this question. Options are: "small"(11px), "normal"(14px), "large"(17px), "extra large"(20px) and "huge"(24px).
help.mcq.description:ui_style.orientatio: Display possible responses vertically or horizontally, when the Number of columns is set to > 1.
help.mcq.description:ui_style.type: Formatting styles available for the question.
help.mcq.description:ui_style.validation: Numeration character to be displayed to the left of the validation label.
Numeration characters displayed to the left of the validation label. Only visible in review state.
help.mcq.description:validation: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
help.mcq.description:validation.allow_ne: Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
help.mcq.description:validation.alt_resp: Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
help.mcq.description:validation.automark: Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.
help.mcq.description:validation.max_scor: The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
help.mcq.description:validation.min_scor: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
help.mcq.description:validation.penalty: A value which indicates how many marks will be deducted for an incorrect response.
help.mcq.description:validation.rounding:
Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.
help.mcq.description:validation.scoring_:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
help.mcq.description:validation.unscored: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
help.mcq.description:validation.valid_re: The correct response for the question.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).
help.mcq.name:options[*].label: Label
help.numberline.description:: Place points on a number line
help.numberline.description:feedback_att: If Check Answer is enabled, this field determines how many times a user can click on the Check Answer button. 0 means unlimited.
help.numberline.description:instant_feed: Enables the Check Answer button underneath the question, which will provide the student with instant feedback on their response(s).
help.numberline.description:instructor_s: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.
help.numberline.description:is_math: Enabling this option allows LaTeX or MathML to be rendered in the question. If you try to enter math while this option is disabled, the LaTeX/MathML will not render properly on screen.
help.numberline.description:labels: Defines the labels to draw on the number line
help.numberline.description:labels.frequ: The frequency with which the labels should be displayed on the number line. E.g. when set to "2", a label is drawn on every second tick.
help.numberline.description:labels.point: Insert any specific points at which a label should be drawn. If there is more than one point, separate values by commas, e.g. "-2.5, 2.5".
help.numberline.description:labels.show_: Displays a label on the maximum value of the number line.
Displays a label on the minimum value of the number line.
help.numberline.description:line: Defines the minimum and maximum values on the number line.
help.numberline.description:line.left_ar: Displays an arrow on the left hand side of the number line.
help.numberline.description:line.max: The maximum value on the number line.
help.numberline.description:line.min: The minimum value on the number line.
help.numberline.description:line.right_a: Displays an arrow on the right hand side of the number line.
help.numberline.description:line.title: The title of the number line.
help.numberline.description:math_rendere: When a question contains math, this setting allows you to select your preferred math renderer: MathJax or MathQuill.
help.numberline.description:metadata.ack: A multi-use field that is used to add acknowledgements (copyright, credits, thanks).
help.numberline.description:metadata.dis: Used to display response feedback/rationale to the student.
Used for storing the distractor rationales that map to responses in the same order for use/rendering by the host environment.
help.numberline.description:metadata.rub: Refers to a pre-created rubric in the Learnosity item bank.
help.numberline.description:metadata.sam: A sample answer that is stored for display/reference when teacher scoring.
help.numberline.description:points: Array containing the points the user has to position on the number line. Possible formats are: text, number, fraction and mixed fraction. The field doesn't support LaTeX because of rendering complexity.
help.numberline.description:snap_to_tick: Defines whether the draggable points should snap to tick marks on the number line.
help.numberline.description:snap_vertica: Whether dragged points should snap to the line when dropped above it
help.numberline.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
help.numberline.description:stimulus_rev: Shows an alternate (e.g. abbreviated) question stimulus when in review mode.
help.numberline.description:ticks.base: Defines the base value on the number line, where ticks should start. Options: line minimum value or zero.
help.numberline.description:ticks.distan: The distance between ticks on the number line.
help.numberline.description:ticks.fracti:
If the ticks distance is set to a fraction this will determine in which format the fractions will be displayed on the number line. Options are:
  • not normalized and mixed fractions;
  • normalized and mixed fractions;
  • improper fractions.
help.numberline.description:ticks.show: Display ticks on the number line.
help.numberline.description:ui_style.fon: Controls the size of the font for this question. Options are: "small"(11px), "normal"(14px), "large"(17px), "extra large"(20px) and "huge"(24px).
help.numberline.description:ui_style.hei: The height of the number line container. When set to "auto", or undefined, the height will be scaled automatically based on the contents. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "10em".
help.numberline.description:ui_style.lin: Position of the number line in %, relative to the height of the container. E.g. 50% would display the number line in the centre of the container.
help.numberline.description:ui_style.num: The distance from the number line extremes to the sides of the number line container. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "1.2em".
help.numberline.description:ui_style.poi: Position of the point box in %, relative to the height of the container.  E.g. With this setting at 66%, the point box section would span 1/3 of the total container.
The distance between two points in the points container. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "10em".

The position of points, relative to the height of the points container. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "10em".
help.numberline.description:ui_style.tit: Position of the number line title in %, relative to the height of the container.  E.g. 1% would display the title at the top of the container.
help.numberline.description:ui_style.wid: The width of the number line container. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "10em".

help.numberline.description:validation.a: Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.

The position on the number line the point should represent.
Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.

Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
help.numberline.description:validation.p: A value which indicates how many marks will be deducted for an incorrect response.
help.numberline.description:validation.r:
Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.
help.numberline.description:validation.s:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
help.numberline.description:validation.t: Defines the threshold for the distance a point can be from the valid point, and still be marked as correct. For instance, if the valid position is "1" and threshold is set to "0.2", all points in the range fron "0.8" to "1.2" will be correct.
help.numberline.description:validation.u: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
help.numberline.description:validation.v: The correct response for the question.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).
The point that should be validated.
The position on the number line the point should represent.

help.orderlist.description:: Presents the user with a list of sentences to be sorted into the correct order. Tapping or dragging items is supported.

help.orderlist.description:instant_feedb: Enables the Check Answer button underneath the question, which will provide the student with instant feedback on their response(s).
help.orderlist.description:instructor_st: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.
help.orderlist.description:is_math: Enabling this option allows LaTeX or MathML to be rendered in the question. If you try to enter math while this option is disabled, the LaTeX/MathML will not render properly on screen.
help.orderlist.description:list: An unordered list of statements that the student must place in the correct order.
help.orderlist.description:math_renderer: When a question contains math, this setting allows you to select your preferred math renderer: MathJax or MathQuill.

help.orderlist.description:ui_style.show: An icon to the left of each response option that indicates to the student that the item can be dragged.
help.orderlist.description:ui_style.type: Order list formatting styles; select from button, list, and inline.
help.orderlist.description:ui_style.vali: Numeration characters displayed to the left of the validation label. Only visible in review state.

help.orderlist.description:validation.al: Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.

help.orderlist.description:validation.ma: The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
help.orderlist.description:validation.mi: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
help.orderlist.description:validation.pe: A value which indicates how many marks will be deducted for an incorrect response.
help.orderlist.description:validation.ro:
Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.
help.orderlist.description:validation.sc:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response entity will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response entity will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between the response items.
  • Partial Pairwise Per Response - Entities are compared in pairs to determine the score.

help.plaintext.description:: Long essay questions which does not include formatting controls.
help.plaintext.description:character_map:
A character map with non-typical letters and special symbols will appear in the response area. There are 3 character maps available:
  • Standard alpha
  • Numerical (appears by default when Has Mathematical Formulas? is enabled)
  • Custom (insert special characters in the Characters to Display field)
help.plaintext.description:instructor_st: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.

help.plaintext.description:max_length: Maximum number of words that can be entered in the text entry area (max 10,000 words).

help.plaintext.description:show_copy: When enabled, the copy button will be displayed to the student in the text entry area toolbar.
help.plaintext.description:show_cut: When enabled, the cut button will be displayed to the student in the text entry area toolbar.
help.plaintext.description:show_paste: When enabled, the paste button will be displayed to the student in the text entry area toolbar.
help.plaintext.description:show_word_lim:
Defines whether the word limit should be displayed in the toolbar or not. The options are:
  • Always On - Word Limit is always displayed.
  • On Limit - Word Limit will only be displayed when the limit is reached.
  • Off - Word Limit will not be displayed.
help.plaintext.description:spellcheck: Enable or disable browser spellcheck, autocapitalize, autocomplete and autocorrect attributes on the user response area.

help.plaintext.description:submit_over_l: Determines if the user can save/submit text when the word limit has been exceeded.

help.sharedpassage.description:: Enabling a highlightable text passage that can be used across multiple items.
help.sharedpassage.description:content: The content to display in the passage. This field supports HTML formatted data includes font styling, paragraph styling, layout templating, embedded images, resources, LaTeX and MathML.

help.sharedpassage.description:instructo: It will be displayed above the sharedpassage's heading.
help.sharedpassage.description:is_math: Switch to Yes to show formatted mathematical formulas.

A grade level, making it easier for teachers, parents, librarians, and others to judge the readability level of various books and texts.
The Lexile framework for reading is an educational tool that uses a measure called a Lexile to match readers with books, articles and other leveled reading resources.

  • Numerical (appears by default when Has Mathematical Formulas? is enabled)
  • Custom (insert special characters in the Characters to Display field)

Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.

  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.

The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match - Each correct cell will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between the amount of correct cells.
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
The correct response for the question.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).

The validation method for the question. Options are:
  • byLocation - Use when the task is to highlight specific cells on the grid.
  • byCount - Use when the task is to select the correct amount of cells. Cell location does not matter.

The value will be different types according to the method:
'byLocation': value should be an array of form [y, x] that use 1-based indexing rather than 0-based, e.g. [1, 1] means the cell at first row, first column.
'byCount': value should be a number.
